page.title: 07CLIMATE
page.content:
Due to the exposed nature of the countryside the weather is frequently windy. Winters can be harsh; the wind causing severe drifting of the snow. Local hamlets are frequently cut off. Farm animals are wintered in barns for several months. Spring arrives later than in more sheltered areas. The weather can be seen with dramatic effect. From the hill tops raln clouds can be seen sweeping up the valley. On a fine breezy day the shadows of the clouds move across the fields.
